intro: Cissampelos ellenbeckii, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing vine native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, and it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
